definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: Effects which increase Bleed damage also increase Shred damage.
sentences.chinese: 剛又去翻了翻資料，沒說撕碎是流血傷害啊，但是。

sentences.english: But what was happening later stunned me more: the man tore down the dream he just wove.
sentences.chinese: 他又用自己的雙手撕碎了自己剛剛編織好的夢。

sentences.english: He ripped the letters up and threw them in the wastepaper basket.
sentences.chinese: 他把這些信撕碎，扔進字紙簍裏。

sentences.english: Rip all the basil over it, correct the seasoning, and drizzle with good extra-virgin olive oil.
sentences.chinese: 加入撕碎的羅勒，調味，最後淋上特級橄欖油。

sentences.english: He tore it up and rolled it into pipe spills.
sentences.chinese: 他把它撕碎，捲成了點板煙的紙捻兒。

sentences.english: The winter's frost must rend the burr of the nut before the fruit is seen.
sentences.chinese: 只要冬天的寒霜撕碎了堅果的芒刺，才能看到果實。

sentences.english: He tore the photo into pieces.
He tore up the letter after reading it.
sentences.chinese: 他看完信後就把信撕碎了。

sentences.english: The analog to Shred is Backstab, which is positional.
sentences.chinese: 貓的撕碎是盜賊背刺的翻版，是要求位置的。

sentences.english: I shredded the second time printed form 2033.
sentences.chinese: 我把第二次打印的“表2033”撕碎了。

sentences.english: Please don't hurt me again, otherwise i'll undergo heartrending hurt.
sentences.chinese: 請你不要再來傷害我，我會難過，心象被撕碎一樣。

sentences.english: When darkness is banished and all Veils are rended.
sentences.chinese: 當消除黑暗和撕碎全部遮蔽物時候。

sentences.english: The winter's forst must rend the burr of the nut before the fruit is seen.
sentences.chinese: 只有冬天的寒霜撕碎了堅果的芒刺，才能看到果實。

sentences.english: A tiger can pull a roebuck to pieces in a matter of minutes.
sentences.chinese: 一隻老虎可以在幾分鐘內把一隻雄鹿撕碎。

sentences.english: Several pages were torn away by the strong wind, the air of the liberty.
sentences.chinese: 急風已將撕碎了的信吹散，這是自由的空氣。

definition: to tear up/to tear to pieces
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to tear out (and throw away)/to rip away
to dismember/(fig.) to break into parts
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
